name: Ransomware Infection Scenario
description: This ransomware scenario covers the complete incident response lifecycle from initial detection through recovery. You'll practice identifying early encryption indicators, containing lateral movement across your network, assessing damage and planning recovery, and finally eradicating all threats. Each sub-scenario teaches critical skills: recognizing ransomware patterns, implementing network-wide containment, making recovery decisions, and ensuring complete threat removal. Essential training for defending against one of the most damaging cyber threats.

events.title: Rapid File Encryption

You've detected active ransomware encryption with file renames and shadow copy deletion. What is your immediate containment action?

options.text: Isolate workstation-03 from the network immediately
options.explanation: Isolation stops encryption and lateral movement.

options.feedback: Good but prioritize the source host.
options.explanation: Isolate source first to stop propagation.

options.text: Monitor to see how many files get encrypted

events.title: Network-Wide Encryption Detected

Ransomware is spreading laterally via SMB to multiple hosts. What is your containment strategy?

options.text: Isolate all potentially affected hosts and block SMB network-wide
options.explanation: Prevents further spread across the network.

options.text: Block SMB only on the source workstation
options.feedback: Too limited - other hosts already affected.
options.explanation: Doesn't stop propagation from already-infected hosts.

options.text: Monitor to see which hosts get infected
options.feedback: Incorrect. Active spread requires immediate action.

events.description: note.txt created in multiple directories

events.title: Ransom Demand Analysis
events.description: Ransom note demands 5 BTC for decryption key

events.title: Backup Verification Available
events.description: Last backup from 6 hours ago verified clean

events.title: Impact Assessment
events.description: Critical systems affected: file-server-01, db-server-01. Non-critical: workstation-03
Ransomware has encrypted files and dropped ransom notes. You have verified backups available. What is your recovery strategy?

options.text: Restore from verified backups and do not pay ransom
options.feedback: Correct! Best practice is to restore from backups.
options.explanation: Restoring from clean backups avoids paying ransom and ensures data integrity.

options.text: Pay the ransom to get decryption key
options.feedback: Not recommended. No guarantee of decryption.
options.explanation: Paying ransom funds criminals and doesn't guarantee recovery.

options.text: Wait to see if decryption tools become available
options.feedback: Too passive with verified backups available.
options.explanation: With verified backups, immediate restoration is the best option.

options.text: Restore only non-critical systems from backup
options.feedback: Partial solution - restore all affected systems.
options.explanation: All affected systems should be restored to ensure complete recovery.

After containment, you've found persistence mechanisms and C2 infrastructure. What is your eradication strategy?

options.text: Remove persistence mechanisms, block C2 domains, and reimage affected hosts
options.explanation: Complete removal of threats and reimaging ensures clean state.
Doesn't remove existing threats on hosts.

options.text: Restore from backup without removing threats
options.explanation: Must eradicate threats before or during restoration.
